name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Inspect for damage and wear, Confirm items are correct as per drawings and Specifications
Acceptance Criteria - Pipes shall be DN750 Class 4 RCRRJ
○ Items are approved as per contract specification
Verifying Document - Photos, delivery docket, MDD results for backfill materials (if required)
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Set out completed by an approved surveyor marked allignment
Acceptance Criteria - Allignment set out matches drawings, 2D data and linework provided or aggreed with the Engineer
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Excavate to achieve required depth to invert as per C4200, C4300, C4301
○ Trench width to allow for 300mm seperation between springline of the pipe and trench wall or an adjacent pipe
○ Floor of Trench to be even across width and length
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Scala tests on base of trench
Acceptance Criteria - minimum of 2 blows per 100mm
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, On site test
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - pre pour inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Engineers approval to proceed
Verifying Document - Pre pour inspection form
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pipe installed to grade as per drawing C4200, C4300, C4301
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe not damaged during installation
○ Pipe installed to grade within tolerances specification GP 3.1.8
Verifying Document - Photos, Grade check sheet, Survey of position for asbuilt
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Embedment material shall be AP20 or approved by the Engineer in writing
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, measurement check
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Backfill in 200mm layers of compacted material
○ Compaction testing one test every two layers as required
○ Conductive signal strip to be laid at …mm cover
Acceptance Criteria - 95% MDD in roads, paths, and pavements
Verifying Document - Photos, Compaction test results
Frequency - During Installation, compaction testing per 50m of pipeline or per straight section of pipeline
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, On Site test

Acceptance Criteria - Items are approved as per contract specification

Acceptance Criteria - Allignment set out matches drawings or aggreed with the Engineer

○ Trench width to allow for 300mm seperation between springline of the pipe and trench wall or an adjacent pipe
○ Floor of Trench to be even across width and length
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Scala tests on base
Acceptance Criteria - minimum of 2 blows per 100mm
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, On site test
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Bedding minimum 75mm compacted material
Acceptance Criteria - Bedding to comply with requirements
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, Measurement Check
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Chambers installed true to the design level
Acceptance Criteria - Final levels are in accordance with the drawings or within tolerance and agreed with the Engineer

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Benching concrete shall have a crushing strength of 20MPa at 28 days. All benching and sloping surfaces on manhole floor shall be rendered in 20mm thick 1:3 mortar
○ Benching shape to have smooth transitions at bends and junctions
Acceptance Criteria - Benching built up to the specifications
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, measurement check
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Backfill in 200mm layers of compacted material
○ Compaction testing one test every two layers as required
Acceptance Criteria - 95% MDD in roads, paths, and pavements
Verifying Document - Photos, Compaction test results
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, On Site test
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Manholes to be water tested up to within 150mm of the concrete lid level.
Acceptance Criteria - The amount of water leakage from chamber under test shall not exceed 1/300 of the volume of the chamber during a 30 minute period
ITP-4003 - DN750 WC main WCMH-5 to WCMH-4

Acceptance Criteria - Pipes shall be DN600 Class 4 RCRRJ
○ Items are approved as per contract specification

Acceptance Criteria - Allignment set out matches drawings or aggreed by the Engineer
Frequency - Prior to commencement of works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Excavate to achieve required depth to invert as per C4200
○ Trench width to allow for 300mm seperation between springline of the pipe and trench wall or an adjacent pipe
○ Floor of Trench to be even across width and length
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Install Bidim A29 or approved equivalient around bedding, haunch, overlay zone and trench fill up to the subbase.
Acceptance Criteria - Geotextile not damged during pipe installation and backfilling
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Scala tests on base of trench
Acceptance Criteria - minimum of 2 blows per 100mm
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, On site test
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Pipe installed to grade as per drawing C4200
Acceptance Criteria - Pipe not damaged during installation
○ Pipe installed to grade within tolerances specification GP 3.1.8
Verifying Document - Photos, Grade check sheet, Survey of position for asbuilt
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Embedment material shall be AP20 or approved by the Engineer in writing
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, measurement check
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Backfill in 200mm layers of compacted material
○ Compaction testing one test every two layers as required
○ Conductive signal strip to be laid at 300mm above pipe
Acceptance Criteria - 95% MDD in roads, paths, and pavements
Verifying Document - Photos, Compaction test results
Frequency - During Installation, compaction testing per 50m of pipeline or per straight section of pipeline
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, On Site test
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - DPM inplace
○ Follow detail 33 at change in floor level.
Acceptance Criteria - steel installed and poured in accordance with drawings.
Frequency - During installation, prior to pours.
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Match existing pavement thickness or minimum of 35mm.
○ Minimum depth of 250mm 28 day strength 20MPa concrete, R20 steel installed at 500mm ctrs, 250mm embedment and 250mm into excavation, placement of 665 steel mesh, coarse broom finish.
○ Mix to be NZTA M/10: AC10
Acceptance Criteria - Asphalt installed as per the design
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, Prepour inspection
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Match existing pavement thickness or minimum of 35mm.
○ Place a tack coat of 0.2-0.5 L/m².
○ Mix to be DG7 Asphaltic Concrete.
Acceptance Criteria - Asphalt installed as per the design
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Length a minimum of 1m.
Acceptance Criteria - Tolerances for kerb and channel and paving edge beam shall be +5mm vertically and E16+3mm horizontally. The deviation from a 4m straight edge shall not exceed 3mm
Inspection Type (Visual, other) - Visual, Pre Pour inspection
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - CCTV inspection to confirm pipeline conforms with specification
Acceptance Criteria - Pipeline will fail is any of the following is visible:
○ Pipe misalignment or deformation more than 5% of the pipe diameter
○ Dips or ponding of water inside the pipe
○ Defects such as open joints, potruding laterals, cracked barrels, or similar
Verifying Document - Test Records, CCTV footage
Frequency - Every section of pipe completed
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Tested in the presence of the Engineer or their representative testing in accordance with AS/NZS 2566.2 Section 6.4
Frequency - Every section of pipe installed
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Complete mark up of any changes from supplied drawings
Frequency - After completion of pipe section
